TopicTitle: Launch First Vessel Contract Problem v1.0

Articles.Content:
Hey folks

So, I've started the career mode and have done a lot of contracts so far, all of them using vessels, both unmanned and manned, but for some reason i still have not completed the "Launch First Vessel" Contract. I searched on forum but could not find any post related. 

Is it possible that I am missing some weird detail on the contract? Or is it some sort of bug?

Ps: If there is already a post about it, feel free to give me a warning.
Have you accepted the contract from mission control? Otherwise I don't know, maybe you already completed it without realising?

No, Ziggy is right. There is something going on with the "Launch First Vessel" contract, as I've launched tons of missions and this contract fails to complete.

That said, I'm using the Mission Controller 2 mod, so it's entirely possible the error is with that mod. Ziggy, are you using this mod as well?

If not, we know the problem is not in fact related to that mod and there is something else going on.

I've not seen this in stock yet, though I'm not sure if I've tried to trigger this yet in 1.0.2.

Please do try to narrow down if it's due to the mod or not, so we can make sure the bug report gets to the right place.

Cheers,

-Claw

> 
> I've not seen this in stock yet, though I'm not sure if I've tried to trigger this yet in 1.0.2.
> Please do try to narrow down if it's due to the mod or not, so we can make sure the bug report gets to the right place.
> 
> Cheers,
> 
> -Claw

I'm playing completely unmodded, freshly installed on Steam, and have this issue. The debug console does not show anything strange. Please tell me if I can help narrow it down further.
I think you have to launch with your first stage directly touching the launchpad - it seems that when I was using the launch sticks from the sounding rockets mod, it "doesn't count" as a launch.
I know this is TOO old, but I just managed to clear this mission after removing Community Tech Tree mod. Then I added it back and nothing bad happened (yet xD)

This usually indicates that a problem occurred in the contract system, but I can't remember how to troubleshoot it.

Does anyone remember how to troubleshoot problems in the contract system when "Launch First Vessel" contract keeps reappearing in the offered list?

You may be better off asking in Support WuphonsReach, and uploading your outout\_log.txt and persistent.sfs files to a file host and providing the links.

All you need to do to complete that contract is to launch a crewed pod with a flea booster from the surface of Kerbain, though a parachute would be appreciated by the occupant.

So if it's not completing or reappearing there's something causing it, such as a mod or a broken save.

I suspect it kept showing up because in this career save, I jump-start myself with funds and science and always use launch clamps on my first launch.  That particular contract only seems to complete if you launch something without launch clamps.
Oh yeah that will do it, you don't start with clamps and that contract specifically checks for a vessel leaving the surface.

> 
> 
> On 5/3/2015 at 3:12 PM, westamastaflash said:
> 
> 
> I think you have to launch with your first stage directly touching the launchpad - it seems that when I was using the launch sticks from the sounding rockets mod, it "doesn't count" as a launch.
> 

This is it. I used to think you had to use that first, tiny solid motor, but nope. I just tried it with a liquid rocket, and it works as long as you don't use launch clamps/towers, etc. Just the rocket sitting on the ground when you launch.

And yes, this is an old question, but it's still a problem in 1.1.3.

**Edited <time datetime="2016-09-09T07:58:34Z" title="09/09/2016 07:58  AM" data-short="7 yr">September 9, 2016</time> by RocketBlam**

Launch a simple vessel with a "flea" booster.  This contract assumes that you started with none of the tech tree unlocked and expects you to use a flea booster.  Unless they fixed that bug and I wasn't paying attention.
